meanings.definition: Distribute (resources or duties) inappropriately or inefficiently.
meanings.sent1: The company misallocated the work tasks, causing confusion among employees.
meanings.sent2: The government misallocated the funds, leading to a lack of essential services.
meanings.sent3: The party planner misallocated the seating arrangements, creating an awkward atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: The coach misallocated playing time, affecting the team's performance.
meanings.sent5: The student misallocated study time, resulting in poor grades.
